headline.main: To Raise a Down Syndrome Child (6 Letters)
headline.print_headline: To Raise a Down Syndrome Child

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Prenatal Test Puts Down Syndrome in Hard Focus'' (''The DNA Age'' series, front page, May 9):

headline.main: To Raise a Down Syndrome Child

docs.abstract: Six letters respond to May 9 article in series DNA Age on how genetic testing could decrease number of children born with Down syndrome; William Motley suppports fighting Down syndrome with prenatal testing; Susan Colodney says there are 'tremendous joys' in raising child with Down syndrome; Sue Palmer says she objects to group concerned about future 'shortage' of people with Down syndrome; Dr Gil Herzberg expresses shock that people would advocate that others go through enormous social, medical and financial burdens that come with Down syndrome; Marion Hunt asks what happens to Down syndrome adults when parents are no longer able to care for them; Prof Gary N Siperstein says many people with Down syndrome are capable of wide range of self-help and independent living skills; drawing
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     Re ''Prenatal Test Puts Down Syndrome in Hard Focus'' (''The DNA Age'' series, front page, May 9):
